title: a
text: audit logs needed (i.e., event types to be logged) to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity are specified

title: b
text: the content of audit records needed to support monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful or unauthorized system activity is defined

title: c
text: audit records are created (generated)

title: d
text: audit records, once created, contain the defined content

title: e
text: retention requirements for audit records are defined

title: f
text: audit records are retained as defined

title: a
text: the content of the audit records needed to support the ability to uniquely trace users to their actions is defined

title: b
text: audit records, once created, contain the defined content

title: a
text: a process for determining when to review logged events is defined

title: b
text: event types being logged are reviewed in accordance with the defined review process

title: c
text: event types being logged are updated based on the review

title: a
text: personnel or roles to be alerted in the event of an audit logging process failure are identified

title: b
text: types of audit logging process failures for which alert will be generated are defined

title: c
text: identified personnel or roles are alerted in the event of an audit logging process failure

title: a
text: audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes for investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity are defined

title: b
text: defined audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes are correlated

title: a
text: an audit record reduction capability that supports on-demand analysis is provided

title: b
text: a report generation capability that supports on-demand reporting is provided

title: a
text: internal system clocks are used to generate time stamps for audit records

title: b
text: an authoritative source with which to compare and synchronize internal system clocks is specified

title: c
text: internal system clocks used to generate time stamps for audit records are compared to and synchronized with the specified authoritative time source

title: a
text: audit information is protected from unauthorized access

title: b
text: audit information is protected from unauthorized modification

title: c
text: audit information is protected from unauthorized deletion

title: d
text: audit logging tools are protected from unauthorized access

title: f
